Description.div: The AggregateSupplyOfNonRequestedTag flag indicates whether the system has aggregated the supplies that are returned by the API. If the flag is set to Y, supplies are aggregated irrespective of the tag information and displayed in the output XML. If the flag is set to N, supplies are returned in the output XML with the tag information.

An enterprise can configure multiple allocation rule sets with different document types. If an AllocationRuleID is passed, the allocation rule set is associated with the AllocationRuleID is used to select Option.
The AllocationRuleID passed must be valid for both the Enterprise's rule set and document type of the order.
Carrier service code.

Indicate if inventory should to be checked.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y Y or N
If Y , either the DistributionRuleId passed or the organization's default DistributionRuleId is used to obtain a distribution rule for supply and demand filtering for the availability calculations.
If N , either the DistributionRuleId passed or the organization's default DistributionRuleId is used to obtain a distribution rule for inventory availability. No supply or demand is read. Distribution drives inventory availability calculations.
Indicates the Customer ID on which behalf inquiry is being made. Customer preferences are used in capacity computations.

A flag to determine if inventory options should be based on DeliveryDate or ShipDate.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y Y or N
If DeliveryDateBased
is passed as y , base options on DeliveryDate.
If DeliveryDateBased
is passed as N , base options on ShipDate.
Default Delivery method.

Specifies a DemandType used in the inventory availability calculations.
Default: OPEN_ORDER
Only valid SupplyTypes that can be consumed against the DemandType value are considered in the inventory availability calculations.

If multiple lines are provided in the criteria, the value of the DependencyShippingRule indicates how the lines are dependent on each other. If the DependencyShippingRule is not passed, no dependency rule is applied to the lines.
Valid values:
01 - Ship together. This choice causes the resulting Options to have inventory from the same ShipNode.
02 - Deliver together.
Indicates radius within which nodes can be considered for final leg sourcing. If distance between shipping node and ship to address is greater than this distance, node will not be used for sourcing.
Indicates radius unit of measure.

An ID that identifies an distribution rule, which can be used in inventory processing.
If the DistributionRuleId is passed, supplies and demands are read by applying the associated distribution rule filter.
If the DistributionRuleId is not passed, the Organization's default DistributionRuleId is used.
The EnterpriseCode on which behalf inquiry is being made. If not passed OrganizationCode primary enterprise will be used.
Depicts the method of fulfilling the order line during scheduling. This field can be matched with the corresponding field in YFS_Sourcing_Rule_Hdr table and appropriate sourcing rule can be selected.

Flag to ignore Minimum Notification time associated with Item and Shipnode.
Valid Values: Y or N

If IgnorePromised is passed as Y , promised demands are not considered during inventory availability calculations.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

If IgnoreUnpromised is passed as Y , unpromised demands are not considered during inventory availability calculations.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicate if substitution is allowed for Items.
Valid Values: Y or N

Positive integer used to determine the maximum number of possible solutions to find.
Default: 1
Valid positive integer.

This value determines the optimization rules to be applied to the scheduling process.
Default: 01
Valid Values:
01 : Optimize on date.
02 : Optimize on ShipNode priority.
03 : Optimize on number of shipments.
Used to identify order.

Inventory is being checked on behalf of the organization specified by OrganizationCode.
Must be an existing Organization.

If the AllocationRule's UseGeography flag is set to Y , the ReceivingNode's location is used to calculate the priority of the Option.
Must be an existing ReceivingNode.
End Date upto which to look inventory
Start Date from which to look inventory
Carrier being used.
Scac And Service Key
Inventory segment
Inventory Segment type
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found.
Used for sourcing rule determination.

The UseUnplannedInventory flag indicates that system should assume that there is available unplanned inventory (inventory for which assumes to be available on current date + item's lead time) for any unavailable quantities. If the UseUnplannedInventory flag is passed, it will override the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item in the catalog. Otherwise, the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item will be used.
The AvailableFromUnplannedInventory flag indicates that one or more assignments of the option consumes from the unplanned inventory when the UseUnplannedInventory flag is set to Y .
First Date inventory is available
Flag to indicate if there is any unavailalbe product or service quantity.
Last Date when Inventory can be obtained
Indicates least priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Indicates maximum priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Total Quantity vailable at the Node through assignments.This field is required.
Option Number
Total number of shipments

Flag to indicates whether inventory is replaced with the Preferred Substitute.
Valid Values: Y or N
Unique identifier for the parent line.
Flag to indicate if the promise line is a bundle parent.
Kit Code
Indicates ratio between the promise lines. This should be passed when ShipTogetherInRatio under Promise is set to Y. Decimal Ratios are not allowed.
Unique identifier for the line.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that promise line can schedule against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered.
Default: None
The ItemId of the substitute that is used in place of the original item.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.
Required Quantity
Scac And Service Key
Tag Number
Assignment node gives details on the availability of the inventory.
Pre reserved quantity from supporting lines.

The AvailableFromUnplannedInventory flag indicates that the assignment consumes from the unplanned inventory when the UseUnplannedInventory flag is set to Y . In case of bundle parents, this indicates if any component assignment of this assignment has consumed unplanned inventory.
Delivery Date of the assignment
Distance between the Shipping Address and Node's address measured in MILES.
Specifies the reason for empty assignment.This is a required field.
Flag to indicate if the node is an External Node
Number of the interaction
This is a required attribute for supporting external availability. The value indicates the actual available quantity at the node.
This is a required attribute for supporting external availability. The value indicates the actual inventory available date at the node.
Flag to indicate if the promise assignment is against an Idle Asset
Product can not be delivered after this date.
Node which will be used for forwarding.
Product can not be delivered before this date.
Priority of the Node.
Product Quantity that can be procured from another node
Date on which the product will be avaliable at the suggested ShipNode.
Quantity that can be obtained for this assignemnt.
Product Quantity that is reserved at the node.This is a required field.
Carrier Code determined by routing.
Quantity for which segment has been changed.
Shipment Date
Node from which inventory is available
Quantity substituted for the original item.This is a required field.
Quantity actually present.
date on which inventory is available.
Flag to indicate if substitution is an Idle Asset
ItemID of the substitute Item
Substitute Items product quantity that can be procured from another node
Product class of the substitute Item
Quantity of the substitute Item
Substitute Items product quantity that is reserved at the node.
Unit Of Measure of the substitute Item
Flag to indicate if procurement is against an Idle Asset
Indicates node from which Substitute is being procured.
Indicates quantity being procured.
Shipment Date from the procurement node.
Indicates whether ProcureFromNode requires transfer acceptance.
Quantity actually present.
date on which inventory is available.
Flag to indicate if procurement is against an Idle Asset
Indicates node from which product is being procured.
Date on which the product will be avaliable at the suggested Procurement Node.
Indicates quantity being procured.
Shipment Date from the procurement node.

Interaction node gives details such as Date and Time when the product or service item is available. It provides information on whether the interaction involves a product item being delivery or if a service will be done at the specified time.
Date and Time when the appointment ends for Service Line
Date and Time when the appointment starts for Service Line
Carrier
Carrier service code.
Delivery Date of the assignment
DeliveryMethod used for obtaining the promise line. Posible values include Delivery DEL, Ship SHP or Pick Up PICK
First Date inventory is available
Number of the interaction
Flag to indicate if the promise line is a Delivery Line
Item Group Code of the Item present in line. Possible values are Product PROD, Delivery DS or Provided Service PS
Last Date when Inventory can be obtained
Node from where the Service is being done
Organization Code
Shipment Date

Attribute.Name: isHistory
Attribute.Description: Flag to indicate if the address is in history tables.

Reason for non-availability of the Item
Unit Of Measure
